I haven't yet worked on commercial SEO projects, but I am actively learning and transitioning into this field. My background as a developer gives me a strong foundation in the technical aspects of SEO, such as page speed optimization, HTML structure, database query performance, and code efficiency.
Previously, I worked on web application development using JavaScript, Angular, .NET Core, and MariaDB. In these projects, I focused on optimizing database queries, improving application performance, and working with APIs. This experience helps me better understand how search engines crawl websites, how server-side rendering affects indexing, and what technical issues can impact search visibility.
Currently, I am gaining hands-on experience with Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Ahrefs, and Screaming Frog, as well as studying page speed optimization, internal linking, technical SEO audits, and content strategies.
My goal is to gain real-world experience in SEO, work on website optimization, and deepen my knowledge in technical SEO, analytics, and automation. In the future, I aim to combine my development expertise with SEO to create more effective solutions for website performance and search rankings.

Client Communication: I maintain clear communication with clients, offering regular updates on project progress, suggesting strategy adjustments, and addressing any concerns related to SEO performance.

I'm currently focused on deepening my expertise in advanced technical SEO, particularly around site architecture and large-scale website migrations. I've been in SEO since 2018. My journey started with SEO copywriting. It was a great feeling of satisfaction to see many of the blog posts that I had written appearing on the SERPs. However, after a year of copywriting, I experienced burnout due to the heavy workload and poorly crafted content briefs (not all SEO specialists are proficient in creating them). As a result, in 2019 I decided to learn SEO, so that I could start creating those briefs. However, I had a completely different approach to this, as I understood how copywriters think and what annoys them the most. Anyway, I was so inspired to work in this niche that decided to continue my learning and offer SEO services in full complexity.
What is my approach:
If I'm working with a new client then I always start with deep and detailed SEO research ‚Äî competitor research, keyword research, client site audit. These three steps are the most important ones as to grow we need to know three things: what's our status, what opportunities we have, and with whom we are fighting in the SERPs. Once the answers are found ‚Äî I start preparing the SEO strategy.
About my skills:
I have big experience in all main fields of SEO: Technical, On-page, Off-page. However, I don't work with clients who want only Off-page SEO:
1. I simply hate it. I know how to build nice links, and I know how to identify a good and bad link, but I'm not open to being a link builder. I'm able only to control your link builder, so that he won't fool you, do the audits of competitors' backlink profiles.
2. Off-page SEO works best of all in-house. In my opinion, the best links that really drive value to the site are build only in-house, when 100% of your time you spend to one project. I may be wrong, but that's just my opinion.
Guarantees:
1. I don't guarantee, that you will get +100500 sales, +1000% of organic traffic. It is unrealistic to make such calculations since there are many factors of influence and anomalies in the SERPs.
2. I guarantee that I will use only white hat methods and will try to deliver the best I can.
What makes me different:
Unfortunately, there are a lot of lies around this niche. Starting from methods that do not bring anything and ending with promises of golden mountains. I am always honest with my clients and try to do the job with as few resources as possible. I never sell what you don't need.
I have several real cases of successful projects:
1. SEO for Culinary School: 52% of YoY organic growth
2. SEO for a fresh Educational Platform (my own project): from 0 to stable 10K clicks a month in 1 year.
3. SEO for a packaging company: Growth from ¬£69K to ¬£184K in sales in a Year.
4. Content Strategy that lead to 120% of organic growth
More you can find in my LinkedIn Profile
Mostly interested in a managing role / senior level position.  Stable payment of salaries that includes the money transfer fees. An interesting product that is really useful for people. Excellent communication and high-quality organization of processes. Possibility to grow further. Flexible working hours.
